newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: Australia housing groups welcome interest rate cut.
newsitem.headline: Australia housing groups welcome interest rate cut.

text.p: Housing industry groups on Friday welcomed the Reserve Bank of Australia's latest interest rate cut, saying it would help to boost the home market and the economy.
"Lower interest rates should help to consoldiate the recovery in home building which is still somewhat patchy," Housing Industry Association Ltd managing director Ron Silberberg said in a statement.
He said the 0.5 percentage points reduction to 5.5 percent should be seen as a "dividend" from lower inflation, budget deficit reduction and the need for greater jobs growth.
Real Estate Institute of Australia Ltd president Don Brindley said the rate cut would help business investment, consumer confidence and economic growth.

"Today's interest rate cut will encourage sustained economic growth without threatening current low inflation, and hopefully work towards decreasing the existing unacceptable high unemployment levels," Brindley said in a statement.
Australia's unemployment rate remained at 8.7 percent in April. Friday's rate cut was the fourth in less than a year, with rates being cut by a total of two percentage points.
